asset.description: Manages the dialogue between clients and the policy manager

asset.significance: Makes the final decision by combining XACML access control with DHDF data

asset.description: Encapsulates the data and credentials released by a user in a given session.

asset.description: Provides privacy and data handling functionality

goal.name: API control
goal.definition: Users and other stakeholders shall be able to control access by web applications to JavaScript APIs. These APIs may allow access to local and remote resources.
goal.rationale: None

goal.name: Device policy
goal.definition: Users shall be able to create both device-specific and device-agnostic policies.
goal.rationale: None

goal.name: Policy synchronisation
goal.definition: The platform shall provide synchronisation for access control policies, so that policies can be desceibed on one platform and enforced on all.
goal.rationale: None

goal.name: Context-sensitive access control
goal.definition: The platform shall allow context-sensitive access control decisions: e.g. these may change depending on the environment.
goal.rationale: None

goal.name: Qualified data use
goal.definition: The platform shall protect user privacy: access requestors shall be able to qualify how they will use the data they are requesting, and users shall be able to express constraints about data disclosure.
goal.rationale: None

goal.name: Usage Constraint
goal.definition: Users shall specify constraints about data disclosure.
goal.rationale: None

goal.name: Usage Request
goal.definition: Access requestors shall specify how they will use the data they are requesting.
goal.rationale: None

goal.name: Data Usage Request
goal.definition: Users shall specify how they will use data they are requesting.
goal.rationale: None

goal.name: Access request validation
goal.definition: Access requests shall contain a validating DTD or schema.
goal.rationale: This is currently being implemented

goal.name: Canonical request specification
goal.definition: The request specification shall be verified before use.
goal.rationale: Each request is enforced separately by definition. Hence, it's impossible to grant access to more resources than required.

goal.name: User identifier permission
goal.definition: Application shall be authorised to access to user interface.
goal.rationale: User identifier is a controllable resource.

goal.name: Mandated request
goal.definition: Access requests shall be non-repudiable.
goal.rationale: All access requests are served between PZPs over TLS.

goal.name: Messaging authentication
goal.definition: Messaging API users shall be authenticated before API use.
goal.rationale: This can be configured usign the policy framework, but this is not the default.

goal.name: Permissive default policy
goal.definition: The default webinos policy shall be permissive enough to require no modification for the majority of webinos applications.
goal.rationale: The API default options are reasonable given the majority of expected applications.

goal.name: Policy file validation
goal.definition: Policy files shall contain a validating DTD or schema.
goal.rationale: This is currently being implemented.

goal.name: Policy management secrecy
goal.definition: Policy management requests shall be visible only to authorised users.
goal.rationale: Policy management calls are sent over TLS.

goal.name: Secret request enforcement channel
goal.definition: Request enforcement channels shall be visible only to authorised users.
goal.rationale: Access requests come either over the overlay network (which is only served using TLS) or between the widget renderer and PZP using a secure websocket. However, there is the potential for man-in-the-browser attacks.

goal.name: Restricted request specifications
goal.definition: User agent requests to network resources shall be restricted.
goal.rationale: Requests to access network resources are represented by the feature http://webinos.org/action/network-access

goal.name: Restricted resource
goal.definition: Resource restrictions shall be commensurate with their specifications.
goal.rationale: Each request is enforced separately by definition. Hence, it's impossible to grant access to more resources than required.

goal.name: Specified resource
goal.definition: Access requests shall specify the resources required authorisation.
goal.rationale: Policy manager permits or denies access to resources only after matching the requested feature list against policies. Therefore, all required resources must be specified in the requests. However, resources that don't have associated resources cannot be directly controlled by the policy manager.
